text: Anyone here trying for on page Email Validation using something like Neverbounce or Zerobounce?

Hey everyone! I'm trying to install a dataLayer on my page but I'm having some issues... Here's what my code looks like:
`<script>`
`dataLayer.push(`
`{`
	`"event": "discoveryCall",`
	`"contactId": {{contact.id}},`
	`"firstName": {{contact.firstname}},`
	`"lastName": {{contact.lastname}},`
	`"email": {{contact.email}}`
`});`
`</script>`
Any of you know what's wrong?
Are you getting any errors in the console? What part of this isnt working?

I sometimes have issues referencing hubl vars inside of a JS object. It seems to work better for me when I create single JS vars for the Hubl I want to include and then reference those pieces through their JS counterpart where needed.

```let contactId = {{contact.id}}; 
etc...```
Hey <@UQWGKUEN7> no error in the console but the dataLayer isn't showing up...
It's like as soon as I add a variable my dataLayer disappear. Because I tried inserting the value manually and the dataLayer was there.
<@U7V9DQ31P> No,  I believe this is in  reference to how you load the JS component to your HubSpot modules, you define this in meta.json.
What is that syntax error related to?
<@U03342PKRQQ> Do you have a test page you could send my way?
<@UQWGKUEN7> yes, here you go: <https://offers.vertexmarketingagency.com/en-us/discovery-session-booked>
Also, this is where I added the code:
So youre forgetting to add your commas each entry
But also if the contact Id is unknown it will still fire with nothing.

And I think that in JS
```{
key: value,
key: ,
key: value,
}```
 Is invalid

So im not sure what you are ok with passing if there is an undefined or no value associated with a key. Likely just undefined. or null. But im not sure how this is going to be used on GTM and if that makes sense or not

It might make the most sense to check and see if all of those properties exist using Hubl first. And if they do then add that data layer script. But then you only track people you know about — which is prob what youre after anyway.
Thanks <@UQWGKUEN7>! Do you know why I'm seeing the DL in the page source with the good value but in the console it tells me it's not defined...

Because the script isnt able to execute. Because it’s  an invalid object. You can’t have a blank contactId key. In order for it to be valid you would need the value to either exist or have a default of null or undefined pass through if no hubl value exists
It is printed on the dom because its supposed to print there but the browser can’t do anything with it
Ok, do you know how I could pass a undefine value if it doesn't exist?
So to try it out quickly you could set `{{contact_id|default(undefined)}}`
You might need to wrap undefined in quotes. But im hoping you can pass undefined or null through it no problem
Looks like it's working! Tanks a lot!!
You bet!
